result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Aaron Todd Buggs not in court, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Aaron Todd Buggs.  Attorney Dennis Murphy in court on behalf of Stephanie Krueger for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defendant's appearance is waived. Due to communication breakdown, defendant requested that counsel withdraw. records.addlTxt: Forwarded for signature.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel for Defendant, filed.
All previously ordered conditions of bail remain in full effect.

Defendant Aaron Todd Buggs appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court for Aaron Todd Buggs.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Stephanie Krueger. 

Case in court for a status conference.  This case is tagging along case 19CF4461.  Defendant has a new pending matter in front of the court, 22CF1232.  Defense filed Notice of Motion and Motion for Reduction of Bail.  Bail motion by Defense argued and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 11, Rm 608 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Notice of Motion and Motion for Reduction of Bail

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Aaron Todd Buggs not in court, in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court with 19CF4461.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 25.   All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Aaron Todd Buggs not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference. Court set an additional status conference case date to allow time for defendants other pending felony case, 2022CF1232. Case adjourned to Branch 28.
Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective June 13, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Reserve Judge John Franke, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

After being advised of the new pending case, on Court's own motion, Court sets bail as to this case at $25,000 cash.  An additional $24,500 to be posted.

All other conditions to remain as previously set:
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn in court, defendant Aaron Todd Buggs not in court, in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.

Court is advised that defendant has a new case scheduled for preliminary hearing, currently assigned to Branch 38.
State will be advising that the case should be transferred to this court.

Court orders this case adjourned for status in Branch 28 to allow Case# 22CF01232 to proceed through preliminary hearing.

Defendant Aaron Todd Buggs in court with Attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn; both appear by video.  Defendant Aaron Todd Buggs in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 19CF4461. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: A. Deitsch - MPD Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
